website_summaries.verdict: This stevia and erythitrol blend is ideal for those who prefer stevia as a substitute but want the low glycemic benefits of a sugar alcohol.
pros: Versatile blend of stevia and erythitrol
Can be used for baking and cooking
cons: Some users may experience headaches or gastrointestinal issues

customer_reviews.title: Tastes much better than Swerve.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this stuff! I am doing a ketogenic diet, and most recipes call for Swerve sweetener. I can't get past the cool feeling in my mouth after eating Swerve, but I found this stuff and it's a game changer. To me, it tastes more like real sugar, and you have to use much less than Swerve, plus there's no "cooling" aftertaste with this as there is with Swerve. I now can bake and sometimes my family doesn't even notice it's low carb/no sugar. My 2 year old even likes a lot of my baking. I'm buying more!
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Do not Recommend- Gave me head aches!
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this product and thought Stevia was a great alternative to sugar. However, I've recently been having trouble with head aches and I figured out it's because the #1 ingredient in this is Erythritol. Erythritol (organic or not) has absolutely no known functions for the human body and the reason why it doesn’t provide calories to its consumer is because the body actually can’t break it down. Think twice before you purchase this it is NOT 100% pure stevia! I've been battling migraines for a week now and just figured out it's because I put this in my tea every day. Stay away if you care about your health and look up the side effects.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and Versatile Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Since starting a ketogenic lifestyle and transitioning to LCHF I have tried many a sweetening alternative. To date, Pyure is the best by far! It's the most natural in flavor and there is no aftertaste. It dissovles easily and works for many drinks and food items alike! I will continue to purchase, and perhaps even subscribe.
customer_reviews.author: Dava Greely

customer_reviews.title: Good for Keto dieters
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was supposed to not Have the same cooling aftertaste that Swerve has.... well, it does. But for the price, I'm going to start ordering this instead of ridiculously overpriced Swerve! Keto for life!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: TASTES LIKE POISON!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on other's reviews. I was so shocked when I got my first bag from Amazon. I dipped a finger in it and put it in my mouth and was so repulsed! It tasted like poison. I have used stevia, erythritol and xylitol in the past and none of those taste like this does. I honestly don't know how they sell it! IT IS HORRIBLE TASTING!!! I have to keep drinking water and that is after ingesting maybe 20 granules! I can't imagine putting PYURE SWEETENER in anything! IT WOULD SERIOUSLY RUIN IT!!! AND Amazon won't stand behind the product! They told me I cannot return it to get my money back!!! $15 down the drain LITERALLY!!!
customer_reviews.author: MUSElover

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've been using sugar substitutes for years, opting for healthier alternatives to sugar. This is not the first stevia/erythritol blend I've tried but it is the first one I've been truly disappointed with. The texture is perfect but there is an immediate and distinct bitter undertaste I found most unpleasant. I will use up the bag I bought, perhaps cutting it with other less offensive sweeteners, but I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Debilitating headaches
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This product gives me the most massive headaches I have had in my life!
customer_reviews.author: JSpur

customer_reviews.title: Diet-like aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: This tastes like a fake sweetener and reminds me of drinking a diet coke or something along those lines. I really wanted to love this, as I am trying to not use sugar in my coffee any more, but this was so disgusting. I haven't tried baking with it - I wasn't planning on making baked items anytime soon - but I can't imagine going to all the effort of baking something only to toss out a whole batch. I'm super disappointed, especially since there are so many good reviews. I guess I am just going to have to not used any type of sweetener and get used to that.
customer_reviews.author: cle

customer_reviews.title: There is a terrible after taste
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this when I first got it since I have been looking for a sugar alternative. I tried to use this with my baking and my coffees in the morning but it just did not do the trick. There is a terrible after taste. Also, I am pretty sure this is not organic even though it says so on the label.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has a flavor that does not compliment the drinks I use it in.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Butler

customer_reviews.title: This tastes like chemicals. I will literally NEVER purchase it again
customer_reviews.text: This tastes like chemicals. I will literally NEVER purchase it again. I couldn't possibly fathom how this is organic! Try again, Pyure!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Holy Nasty Aftertaste Batman!
customer_reviews.text: Aftertaste is Horrible! NOW foods organic erythritol is Soooo much better with No aftertaste and is much cheaper, paid $12 for 2 1/2 pounds here on Amazon. Had to throw out the brownies I made with this, not even my kids would touch them!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Bitter, not sweet, gives headache
customer_reviews.text: This must have paid reviews. I cannot imagine someone giving this a positive review. I drank 1/4 cup of coffee using this instead of real sugar. I was not able to finish the cup of coffee. There was no sweet taste. The coffee tasted like it does without sugar. It was very bitter. I also got a weird feeling headache after only drinking that much. I will not risk consuming any more of this product. I bought 4 16 oz bags. They are going in the trash. I wouldn't even give this stuff away.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Thisi is the ONLY Stevia I will use!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried every type of stevia out there and this is the ONLY one I will use. It is completely different. It is not powdery like the others. You need half as much as it has a heavy consistency like sugar does. And it tastes SO MUCH BETTER than any of the other ones. I'm so glad amazon has this stocked on Subscribe & Save which made it easier to ensure I always have it on hand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sweeten much
customer_reviews.text: I have had other stevia sweeteners where I only had to use 1/4 tsp in my coffee. I am using more than 1/2 tsp and it barely sweetens. Also has an obvious vanilla scent to it but doesn't help the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: Taste sweet when you first try it but it has a bad metallic taste after . Tried it 2 times with coffee. Gave up . Threw the entire bag in the trash and it was 99% full I was so upset.
customer_reviews.author: Esstk

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST tasting STEVIA I have ever tried. I have tried several brands. And although the flavor was okay or good, it still did not meet the mark of replacing that sugar taste. Well, this hits that mark. I can't tell the difference between this and sugar. I checked the package a few times to make sure that it was just stevia and no sugar. It is just THAT GOOD! No aftertaste, no bland taste, now powdery.. a perfect replacement. I will see if they have travel size containers as well. THANK YOU for making such a GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Murrell

customer_reviews.title: Headache powder and not 100% organic
customer_reviews.text: I hate to see that this product is full of filler and a dash of Stevia. Erythritol causes headaches and diarrhea.. And this product is mostly erythritol. I now get to toss out this crap. Not 100% organic at all. It won't upload my pic either
customer_reviews.author: Writing Irish

customer_reviews.title: Best 0 carb sugar substitute I found, good amount of sweetness, no after taste
customer_reviews.text: I tried different zero calorie zero carb sweeteners, tried Stevia by itself (do not like the after taste) and Erythritol by itself (has a strange taste of xylitol gum with this light sensation on your tongue - hard to describe, and not as sweet), this product is a blend of both and tastes just like sugar w/o any weird after taste, smells very pleasant and because of Stevia is a good amount of sweetness. Use it for anything - coffee, baking, making your own chocolate, substitute same amount of this as erythritol in recipes. My friends who do not do zero carb/sugar cannot taste the difference and ask surprised "Is it with NO sugar???". Will stock up!
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, not  a healthy choice of stevia--bummed!
customer_reviews.text: According to research online (Go to DrAxe) this specific blend with ERYTHRITOL and ONLY the Rebaudiana extract ----missing the most important ingredient of steviocide---is a toxic blend. Very misleading to call this organic and give it all the bells and whistles of quality when it's just not true. THE BEST FORM OF STEVIA WITH ALL THE HEALTH BENEFITS IS GREEN LEAF STEVIA's where the actual leaf is ground up (so it's green) and hasn't been processed or treated with any harmful additives. I purchased this thinking it was good for me and started feeling the side effects of the Erythritol immediately. Also what is "natural flavor" in the ingredients list?
customer_reviews.author: Taliss1123

customer_reviews.title: Best Sugar Substitute
customer_reviews.text: I have used many sugars substitutes in the past to curb my sugar intake. I have to admit this Pyure Stevia Blend is the best as far as taste and ease of use. I love sweet tea and using this product barley changes the taste. I used to put a 1.25 cups of sugar in my 2 qt tea pitcher and now I use .25 cups of sugar and 3 teaspoons of Pyure and there is practically no taste difference. Also this does not effect the Glycemic index. My sugar level remains normal and does no climb while using this Stevia Product. After all of the products I have used this is definitely the best! Will continue using....
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: It tastes horrible! A total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It tastes horrible! A total waste of money. I wonder if I will ever find a sweetener that tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: LaTisha Long

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Ignore the complainers.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Those people who are complaining about "headaches" are getting from something else. I've used this exact brand for almost a year and a half and haven't never gotten any kind of headache. Neither has my girlfriend. As far as the taste, those who are complaining are comparing it to either straight up sugar, or a stevia/sugar blend. This is NOT sugar. The taste is exactly what it's supposed to be and is totally fine. The complainers are obviously extremely nit-picky. I highly recommend this as a sugar substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse A. House

customer_reviews.title: Taste is AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this at all. The taste is absolutely disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? You thought this would be ok?
customer_reviews.text: Bag was torn/opened and taped up with shipping tape. Sending back!
customer_reviews.author: KMabry

customer_reviews.title: Vanilla favored - not my preference
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn’t fit my taste. Some reason adds vanilla taste and smell to my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like it. You have to use 10 times more product to sweeten something
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy the Trader Joe’s one but I bought this because is much more product for a better price, the problem is that you have to use A LOT of it to sweeten something (10 times more)
customer_reviews.author: Marifer T.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good to me
customer_reviews.text: I really have no idea what people are talking about with an aftertaste, I really don't. I have tried other stevia products and to me, they do not taste sweet at all. I do have a big problem with sweets and having a "sweet tooth," so maybe I'm just not as sensitive to sweetness as others. I do not experience any "chemical" taste or anything like what some of the negative reviews have pointed out. If you are like me and you need this kind of "crutch" as some of the other haughty reviewers have called it, I say give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: midwesterngirl

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I'm on Keto and therefore gave up sugar. This has saved the day. I use it in my coffee and tea with no bitter aftertaste that some others experience. I was pre diabetic a year ago and now I'm not because I replaced this with sugar. My health is improving more and more every day since giving up sugar and going keto. I couldn't be more pleased with my choice to take back my health.
customer_reviews.author: YhwhKhai

customer_reviews.title: Not right for me!
customer_reviews.text: I believe everyone is different!!! But this is how it went for me. When I started KETO I got this brand for sugar replacement cause I’m a huge sweets fan. The day I bought it I made a blue berry crumble. While I was eating the dessert it was awesome! After I stopped eating there was this HORRIBLE lingering after taste. My stomach ended up hurting the after taste was so bad& I just couldn’t get it out of my mouth. I ended up throwing away the whole dessert and I never used this again. I switched to Splenda and I like it much better. Not saying this is a bad product I just couldn’t handle the after taste personally.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Bitter Aftertaste and Slight Cooling Sensation
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all types of Keto-friendly sweeteners and I will definitely not buy this one again. Tried it once and the bitter aftertaste tells all. It also does have a slight cooling sensation as well. Switching to Monkfruit as my main sweetener as side-by-side taste comparisons prove it is so much better with no aftertaste and no cooling sensation. Glad I didn't waste time and expensive ingredients using this in one of my recipes. Busy life = didn't return in time so money wasted, but lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: BeciW

customer_reviews.title: BAD AFTER TASTE
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to Swerve and this wasn't anything close to it. Super bad after taste. Threw in trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good mainstream suger substitute
customer_reviews.text: This sweetener is really pretty good. I have used a lot of different sugar substitutes, and this is my favorite in this price range. It is a good all-around sweetener, it could dissolve a little better but that's my only little complaint. Keep in mind most sweeteners in this price range are mostly a sugar alcohol, with a little stevia mixed in to add more sweetness. Forget about certified organic and US sourcing of ingrediants.
customer_reviews.author: Bjmarks

customer_reviews.title: Don't think this is a Keto friendly product. It's not.
customer_reviews.text: The nutrition labeling on this product is bizarre. Total carbs 2 grams per 1⁄2 tsp. A full teaspoon of pure can sugar has 4 grams of carbs so that makes this product equally as high in carbs as sugar. But how can that be when the ingredients listed are Erythritol and Stevia Leaf extract? Neither of which should have any carbs. The nutrition label claims the 2 carbs are coming from the Erythritol. Since when does Erythritol have carbs? And now for the taste test. I had to put 21⁄2 times as much of it in my coffee than what I use with other Erythritol, Monk Fruit or Stevia sweeteners....that have zero carbs. So about 10 carbs worth.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Winter

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste
customer_reviews.text: This product has really bad fake sugar taste and also aftertaste :(
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Aftertaste seems chemical.
customer_reviews.text: Part of my disappointment is probably my fault because I should have noticed that this is not just Stevia. This product is a mixture of Stevia with Erythritol (sugar alcohol I've read) and Erythritol as primary ingredient. Their ad on this page does not say anything about Erythritol . I didn't notice until tasting it. My family and I have found this leaves a terrible aftertaste. I hope it will work in cooking. It just isn't for us and I won't buy it again. Product description says "Stevia" then "blend" but not that primary ingredient is Erythritol. I know it is advertising, but ad leads you to believe it is Stevia. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen the retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite brand
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand for a while now. I use it in my coffee and have used it in low carb baking and cooking. I love it! I have not noticed any bitter taste like I do with other stevia brands. I have also tried swerve sweeteners because many Keto recipes call for it, but I am not a fan of swerve. It is expensive, hard to find in stores and I don’t like the taste . I can find Pyure on Amazon and even at Walmart. You use 1/2 amount compared to sugar so you end up getting more for your money.
customer_reviews.author: C. S

customer_reviews.title: tastes funny
customer_reviews.text: Not true that it tastes like sugar. I tried it in coffee. Not worth the taste difference. I'll stick with real sugar or try Splenda.
customer_reviews.author: rejinald

customer_reviews.title: Split decision
customer_reviews.text: I personally dislike it. It leaves a weird aftertaste and a cooling feeling in my mouth. However, my husband likes it. So, like anything, it boils down to personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: db4kb

customer_reviews.title: Yuk!  I can almost still taste it.
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I’m trying to find a stevia or stevia blend product that tastes good...aka - no yucky after taste. Zing was by far the best one I’d ever tasted but naturally, they discontinued it. I don’t know how anyone can use this and not get the horrible taste, after taste and even smell that permeates whatever it’s used in. It’s not the bitter taste that is common to stevia products but something else that reminds me of some horrible, old-fashioned medicinal concoction.
customer_reviews.author: TwoBoyMom

customer_reviews.title: love love love this sugar substitute!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I found this on amazon and at the same price as my nearest Walmart. Now I dont have to go out to get it. This pyure brand tastescexactly like sugar but no calories and most important no blood sugar spike or reaction at all. Its made from a plant so its all good. No bitter stevia aftertaste either. I put this in everything but mostly my chai tea which I drink all day every day. This pyure brand also makes some other great products. I also use their maple syrup on my pancakes and most of all in my sweet potatoes. Soooo yummy. I definitly recommend you try it. I think you'll be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: K.elle.h.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Suffering from headaches
customer_reviews.text: First off I did like how it sweetened my coffee or tea. After using this for 5 months I have found it causes my migraine headaches to reappear. I have suffered from these migraines for 15+ years, headaches so bad I could not move or work. However in the past few years I figured out what the triggers were and made the headaches almost nonexistent. The causes/triggers were mostly certain food items. Stevia appears to be one of those items.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Cust

customer_reviews.title: About to reorder this...
customer_reviews.text: We started following a Keto life-style a few months ago and have been delighted at our progress losing weight. We no longer think of it as a 'diet'--it's just how we eat now. We found a few recipes for sweets and one of the recipes mentioned this sweetener by name so I ordered it. Since then, we have used it as well as Swerve. Both work nicely but after comparing the 'aftertaste', we like this one better. Swerve is more convenient--I can buy it at Whole Foods and it is cheaper than buying it on Amazon--at least, it was at the last price check. But this one is worth it for the better flavor and no weird aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sugar Replacement.
customer_reviews.text: My wife follows the Keto Diet and this is the only sugar brand she uses. She had tried countless others before this one and they always left a funky aftertaste. This was a good value for the size. Cheaper than buying it at the local box store. It did come dirty, as if another sugar package had busted next to it, so it needed to be wiped down. Other than that, the package was not damage.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can use 1/4 of what I normally would sweeten things to my taste with Stevia. When I first started using it I thought it had like a cotton candy backtaste to it. But after using it for a month I simply got used to it and actually like the taste better than sugar. Although I do think that I have been drinking more of my favorite drinks, iced sweet tea, and kool-aid more because I can drink with less worry.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lynch

customer_reviews.title: The best sweetener for diabetics
customer_reviews.text: I'm a type 1 diabetic, this is the best sugarless option that I have found so far. It smells almost like marshmallows and I would say it has a bit of marshmallow-like flavor I find that I use about half of what I would use if I were using sugar. For example, if you like 2 teaspoons of sugar in your coffee, just use one when using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Topha

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the one! It tastes sweet almost like sugar without the weird bitter aftertaste like some chemical sweetener. I use it for almost everything, from coffee to cooking. You do have to note that sometimes it doesn't bring the same taste as sugar with cooking but it's still okay to me. In terms of price, I think it's excellent. I went to Walmart yesterday and found the same thing but a bit more expensive than here on Amazon (and with free delivery for prime!). I'll try monk fruit sugar next time and compare it with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yooo

customer_reviews.title: Great sweetener sub
customer_reviews.text: Mostly bought this for coffee (Including dalgona coffee which calls for an uncomfortable amount of granulated sugar) and this is a great substitute. You don't need as much of this to achieve the sweet taste and the texture is just like granulated sugar. I've never done the keto diet but my friends who have have recommended this to me. I read some reviews that mentioned headaches but I haven't experienced those after consuming this. Also, I noticed only after buying this that my local grocer also carries Pyure but charges a few bucks more.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Soo

customer_reviews.title: Makes Delicious Goodies!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently stopped eating sugar (because it is so bad for you), but I will not consumer artificial sweeteners either (equally bad for you if not more so) so Stevia is my only option. I love this one because it is organic. It sweeten well. Even when we have dinner guests, nobody knows that our dessert is sugar free! I have used this to make everything from breakfast bars with fruit to key lime pie to baked cinnamon apples.
customer_reviews.author: Heather T

customer_reviews.title: I had such high hopes
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find a sweetner that everyone in my family liked. We are now two years sugar free. I'm allergic to corn so maltodextrin caused some nasty and painful allergy results. I really thought that this sweetner would cause less problems as there is no corn byproducts. Except it seems that erythritol causes loose bowels. Sure did surprise me and cut my day short at the farmer's market! I'm giving this a three stars as there's nothing on the packaging that gives any warning that erythritol could cause dumping or loose bowels. It's a great product and tastes great, except for the after affects. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: bernadene whitten

customer_reviews.title: Truly Pure.. stevia
customer_reviews.text: Great value and quality product...i have been using the shaker of Pure Pyure from this co. And love it so thought I would try this presentation. Although it is granulated finely and is less sweet than the powder it is a great price as well. I love that it works well in baking uses. NOW... HOW ABOUT selling us the powder, 10x sweeter, in a bulk package? I would buy either an 8 oz or 16 oz package. Thanks for a truly pure product that isn't degraded by fillers or other forms of sugars.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand of Stevia
customer_reviews.text: I really love this brand of Stevia - mainly because of the fact that the company does not add the bad chemicals that a lot of the other brands do - yes I read the labels. For me the taste is also better than a lot of the other brands I don't notice the bad aftertaste that you sometimes get with Stevia blends. I can buy it for the same price at my local grocery store but they do regularly run out so I do plan to continue to buy some from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not going back to regular sugar again !
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t start using this instead of sugar before ! It might be a bit more expensive but it is worth it ! A lot healthier and taste the same ! I even use less than usual because I feel it is sweeter so it does balance out money wise!
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Good for baking
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Stevia blend to bake fourless brownies a few times. They came out amazing. After I cut out sugar and went on a keto diet, I thought sugar alternatives would be gross but I was wrong. Just make sure you don't accidentally use more than your recipe calls for. The sugar alcohol will taste way too strong. I might even recommend using slightly less than your recipe calls for. I hope someone find this helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using sugar replacements for about 3 years on Trim Healthy Mama and this one is by far the one that is closest to the taste of sugar. It dissolves beautifully, has the same consistency as granulated sugar and tastes wonderful. I am a repeat buyer and will stick with this product. All my sweet baking recipes taste so good now.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Allison

customer_reviews.title: Very stevia tasting for stevia dislikers
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this blend. It still tastes heavily like stevia - this does not seem tempered. I may use it in heavily spiced low carb good where it might mask the flavor. I don't normally leave reviews but wanted people to know if you are sensitive to the flavor of stevia, and dislike it I am not sure you will be a fan of this. But if you like stevia then you will find this pleasant. I was looking for a blend to use in cooking that was stringer in the sweet area than some of the other sugarfree sweeteners.
customer_reviews.author: Vivi

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: This is not pure stevia this has erythritol I’m so disappointed but is also my foul I was looking for organic stevia and when this appears I did not realize that saids....organic stevia””””blend””””
customer_reviews.author: ramonsitin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, no weird aftertaste, good in hot and cold
customer_reviews.text: love it. Just because I can't have sugar doesn't mean I wan't everything gag-o-matic sweet. This product allows you to add just the sweet you want. I really like this product and the results I have when I use it. Try it. It's not a million dollar investment. But try THIS one, not the little packets or the liquid. They are ok, but this one is better. There's a slight vanilla taste added, probably to offset the light anise taste I found when I tried straight stevia in hot tea. Even in coffee, as strong as I make it, I tasted the anise. Not with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Twin Fabulous

customer_reviews.title: By Far, my favorite natural sweetner.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several types and brands of natural sweetners and this one is, by far, my favorite. It takes much better than anything else I've tried. A little bit goes a long way. It's quite a bit stronger than sugar so; be careful. Also, I sometimes mix some xylitol with it when I want a more gentle sweetner. It's working quite well for me in my coffee and many recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! First ingredient is erythritol
customer_reviews.text: Started using this in my smoothies. Had an awful, awful gut reaction soon after. Thankfully, it was short-lived but so intense I was on the floor in pain. Not knowing the cause, I tried again. After day 2 of painful reaction, looked at the ingredients. This "stevia blend" has erythritol as the FIRST ingredient. They should call it an "Erythritol blend". :( Bought 2 bags. Both going in garbage because I won't risk having someone else having this reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Karilyn Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: It taste like vanilla and you ruin your drinks
customer_reviews.text: I’m a sweet tea drinker. I started mixing half sugar half tea blend a few months ago. Loved it. Was having crazy work schedule and bought this hot mess of crap because I couldn’t get to the grocery store and didn’t know if I would get there before I ran out of stevia. Well, yeah, this mess ruined my tea. Vanilla. It tastes like freaking vanilla. Worst gallon of tea I have ever made. Don’t buy this stuff. Just make a dash to the grocery store and get what you know.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful of Using this to Bake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a sugar substitute in baking but didn't realize that it doesn't have the same reaction as actual sugar. Even though the packaging says it's a 2:1 sub for sugar to stevia, this only applies to sweetness, not to baking. If you're looking to bake, you should buy a sugar/stevia blend that is for better results. If you're just looking for stevia to put in your coffee, etc. then this will work fine. I baked a cake using just this and it didn't rise or brown and I had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: missesdash

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have tried nearly all of the other artificial sweeteners. Many spike blood sugar and are unusable to me. Most have an aftertaste that is just disgusting and ruins the product for which you used it. Pyure is the most authentic tasting that I have found. It does not spike my blood sugar and as long as you use just enough, there is absolutely no aftertaste. I would be hard pressed to find a comparable product that is as good as this one. I do wish that the artificial sweeteners like Pyure were not quite so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get off sugar, diabetics dream come true!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m diabetic type 2, my daughter has a health and fitness blog called “ Sweats and the City” out of New York. She recommended this product and I just stopped using white sugar, in fact our sugar shaker is full and hasn’t been used. The best part for me and my diabetes is my daily blood sugar has taken a 10 point drop which is fantastic and I expect it to go even lower with continued use. The price point is excellent. The packaging is great, pinch seal keeps it better than a container with a lid. I was hesitant at first but now a believer, for once my kid was right and I was wrong, now healthier.
customer_reviews.author: john a. endres

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Different folks have different taste bud distribution - TRUTH The actual sweet-leaf plant leaves are incredibly sweet, but Stevia is not water-soluble and must be chemically processed for solubility and shelf life) Many people don't taste the bitterness, buy I'm one of those who cannot escape the bitter aftertaste of stevia preparations. I still use it, combined with erythritol, as sweetener for tea. It's diabetic-friendly
customer_reviews.author: Melanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like old marshmallows.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sweetener I could use in iced tea. This isn't it. It tastes of poor quality artificial vanilla and cornstarch. You can mix it alone in water for a "flavored drink". I'm not joking, try it. (This is not a "sugar substitute".) If the manufacture or people leaving reviews said, "Tastes like sad, tired, economically disadvantaged marshmallows." I wouldn't have ordered it. I'll be sticking with other Stevia products.
customer_reviews.author: mr.goodguy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible after-taste!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Who cares if it's got stevia in it, if you can't stand the after taste of whatever Pyure uses? I've had other stevia powders that just sweeten, without the after taste. Won't be buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: J. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, natural sugar replacement
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product almost exclusively now, as I'm trying to use more natural sweeteners than the little yellow packets! The taste is very good, but if you're familiar with such products, there will be a period of adjustment as you get used to a slight bitterness if you use too much. I do still like the flavor. The thing I really love about it is it's very similar look and feel to sugar! Measures and pours just like sugar, and I am baking with it, able to reduce sugar in my baking by at least half! That is worth it to me. I am buying Pyure on a regular basis now.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Z

customer_reviews.title: Should not change the flavor of food it's added to.
customer_reviews.text: It changed the taste of the tea I used. I tried two teas. Never had that happen with any stevia product. Never used this brand . It must be what's added with it, very concerning to me
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product before. I am not a fan of plain stevia because so many have a funny aftertaste. Erithritol does not sweeten as much as I would like and cost enough that I don't want to use a lot. This is a blend of stevia and erithritol and has a very sweet taste so you don't have to use as much and no after taste. I usually use it to make sweet tea, but also use it on cereal and low carb baked goods.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a strange product. I immediately noticed it had a smell and taste I didn't expect - if I had to describe it I would say Vanilla. I actually like it but it was unexpected - reading the label I see "natural flavorings" are added which I guess is what I'm tasting/smelling. Also it does have 2 carbs per serving which was unexpected and something most other products don't have. If this is a "flavored" product, it should say so on the label. I understand the need for additives for bulk and to keep it flowing and all that but the carbs were unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: Schmoo

customer_reviews.title: Mind how much you use
customer_reviews.text: It says is 1:1 to sugar but it doesn’t work that way. It is very sweet I would say more than sugar. And it has a very light flavor. It works for cooking and baking but it will obviously make everything taste different. The flavor sometimes takes over the recipe and you feel it a lot. The package is very confortable though. You can just refill it after it’s over. But I guess I don’t buy things just for the package.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella mendieta plata

customer_reviews.title: I like this okay.  Best sugar substitute besides pure organic 100% stevia.
customer_reviews.text: I use this exactly the same way as I would sugar. So far as I can tell, tThis does NOT have an aftertaste. But it does have a weak flavor which reminds me a little of marshmallows. I like marshmellows, so no problem for most things. Great for tea, cerial, and I even used it for no sugar cheesecake which turned out great. Probably not a good substitute for cooking though. I believe that this is mostly erythritol, and while it is safe, erythritol can cause some problems if you use it too much or too often.
customer_reviews.author: S. Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Prefer it for my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SweetLeaf stevia drops, for my coffee, which worked to satisfy my need for sweetness in my coffee, but always left a bit of an after taste. With Pyure, I don't notice any after taste. It's not an exact flavor replacement, but it's close enough, and takes half the scoops. Since I'm currently on the Keto diet, and can't use regular sugar, this is definitely the answer for sweetening my coffee
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Warren

customer_reviews.title: You use A LOT for a Little bit of Sweetness :(
customer_reviews.text: You have to use an awful lot of this product just for a little bit of sweetness which makes it not a good value. It’s about a 10th as sweet as sugar and about 100th as sweet as Stevia. This has great ingredients and it doesn’t show any fillers so I don’t understand why it’s not a lot sweeter? I will Not buy this again because it’s too expensive to use. I will go back to Kal Organic Stevia and Xylitol.
customer_reviews.author: StarWarsians

customer_reviews.title: Nasty tasting....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Stevia sweetner blend thinking that it would be great for me to use instead of cane sugar. Well, I have tasted so much better! This product tastes so sickly sweet that my stomach reeled. The after taste was horrible! Thought I would return it back....but guess what! It is UN-RETURNABLE! Imagine that! Makes you wonder what they know...I would NOT advise on buying this brand of Stevia sweetner blend.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Borror

customer_reviews.title: A safe natural sugar replacement, no after taste.
customer_reviews.text: I know many use this on no carb and low carb but for myself, I simply stopped using mane made sugar as I found out I am insulin resistant. Just dropping manufactured sugar and getting it naturally through fruit and vegetables made me feel so so much better. Why this then? I cook quite a bit daily and have a spouse addicted to cakes and pies, and being I still like the occasional treat also this and almond flour is just healthier. I was using straight up Stevia but ack it's okay in drinks but not baking. THIS tastes like the real deal! Try it yourself! Live & learn your never too old.
customer_reviews.author: Othermom

customer_reviews.title: This is granulated Erythritol with a little Stevia.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff does taste good. It works well with all uses. However, these products need to be more honest in what you are getting. The packaging states that a serving is 2g, in that 2g you get 2g of Erythritol. You might ask, 'where's the stevia?' It's just a very small, unmeasurable, amount of stevia. The good is that Erythritol seems to be safe and effective, but is used as a sweetener in many products as xylitol, sorbitol and maltitol.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Closest thing to sugar tase I've found
customer_reviews.text: I live on a high protein, low carb eating plan, so sugar (in all its forms) is off the table (really!) I have tried most of low carb, natural sweeteners on the market, and I used to mix my own stevia/xiltol/erythritol blend. When I ran out of my sweetener combo one day, I went to the store to look for something to "make do". That's when I found this Pyure blend sweetener. I gave it a try and haven't gone back to my do-it-yourself mix! It tastes more like real sugar and I detect no weird after-taste. Very smooth and sugar-like in coffee. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Not too sweet and goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: The size of the bag lasts for a while! I add just teaspoon to my matcha twice a day. As a person who used to grow and harvest [plus produce] Stevia - I was quite impressed by the taste and quality of this brand. The dry powdered person [organic too] is by far better than agave and sugarcane. I look forward to baking with this.
customer_reviews.author: IrisStarlight

customer_reviews.title: Bitter taste...
customer_reviews.text: This product says it has no bitter after taste, but it does. I thought I would try it since it's cheaper than Eryritol, but it made my cake taste bitter. I am trying to use it by mixing it with Eryritol, which helps mask the bitter taste. It is much stronger than Eryritol, so you use less, but Eryritol tastes like sugar and this stuff doens't.
customer_reviews.author: Blondy5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sweetener
customer_reviews.text: This sweetener is twice as sweet as Swerve and other similar sweeteners. I like using it in cheesecake and ice cream. Often Swerve will leave a burning sensation in the back of the throat when used in ice cream. This sweetener doesn’t do that. For example, if the ice cream recipe calls for 1 cup of brown sugar, I’ll use 1/2 c Swerve brown sugar and 1/4 c Pure. (In real life the recipe calls for 1/2 sweetener but 1 cup is easier to illustrate point)
customer_reviews.author: D_Nichols

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap for a reason people.
customer_reviews.text: The ad is misleading, the word "SET" usually means (2) or more. This is ONLY ONE light. It also says "Comes with 4 Pieces of Exchangeable Color Tubes" This is also wrong, later is says 2 pieces of color tubes. Mine only had (1) color tube. IE Missing parts, looked like it was a return. Put it back in the box and sent back immediately. The only good thing I can say is "They did not charge for the return shipping" So I'll give them 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Use in small doses
customer_reviews.text: Use this with caution. I bought this because my research said this was a good alternative besides Stevia. It does taste better than Stevia, however it causes diarrhea and stomach pain when used in large quantities. I used it recently as a replacement for stevia, so I put it in everything like my coffee, oatmeal, anything that I would normally sweeten. I was up in so much pain and with diarrhea after using it. Now, I use it for baking every now and then. It’s a good price but it can wreak havoc on your stomach if you’re using it as a sugar replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis S.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong cooling effect
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with TruVia, but wanted to try something different. This was not usable for me. I tried it in some herbal iced tea, and I had to throw it down the drain. I didn't like the flavor at all, and it had a very strong cooling effect that you get with some non-sugar sweeteners.
customer_reviews.author: Energy Coach

customer_reviews.title: Looks taste and acts like powdered sugar! Must have for Keto!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stevia! The product bakes exactly like sugar - without the sugar. This is absolutely a must have for the keto dieter. If I am baking keto treats I will use this stevia as well as cream cheese to make frosting. That only makes the treat that much better! 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brannon

customer_reviews.title: It's A Good Price For a Stevia Blend
customer_reviews.text: This stevia/erythritol blend looks like sugar, but has a hint of vanilla. It does not taste bitter as Stevia alone does. Once you mix it into a volume of something (ie. 2 liters ice tea), it loses the hint of vanilla taste, which I'm pleased about. I like the taste of Trulia (also a Stevia/erythritol blend) much better. However, Pyure Stevia Blend is much more cost effective, and it definitely tastes better than Sweet'N Low!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. TRETINA

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the taste of this sugar substitute I use it with every thing my morning coffee with my afternoon smoothie and later with my dinner lemonade honestly I never though I was going to find something so close to sugar taste and I’m glad I did this is wonderful option with o calories and 0 carbs I’m a happy customer 😀
customer_reviews.author: Cielo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: Had a bad time with it. Didn't like the taste. A bit of imitation vanilla-ish. I use stevia all the time but wasn't home so I bought this. After two weeks of using it in my morning coffee, I was wondering why I was having headaches and stomach problems. I usually don't have these. Researched the erythritol and found that it effects some people in this manner. Didn't like the taste or the side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Nanciellen

customer_reviews.title: Delicious but Pricey
customer_reviews.text: This sweetener blend has a light taste and works well for baking. As a diabetic, I've tried to find the best low glycemic sweetener and this one is pretty awesome. I'd use it for everything but it just isn't cost efficient for me. So I reserve it for baking and cooking, especially when I'll be sharing my food with others.
customer_reviews.author: Paradox Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stuff. I've been buying it for a while now since its keto friendly. It almost has a hint of vanilla in it so its AMAZING in coffee. It doesn't have that cooling effect that you get with alot of other sweeteners. I personally take about half of it and run it through my blender to make it a powder. It dissolves easier in my cold coffee and helps to keep a smoother texture in whipped cream and fat bombs. Its the only sweetener we use anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L.

customer_reviews.title: Blend. NOT stevia
customer_reviews.text: I bought this believing it was ACTUALLY stevia. Instead, it's just erythritol with a little bit of stevia. Erythritol is added to almost all stevia to make it more granular. However, this is 90% erythritol. As an example, 1/4 tsp is enough stevia to sweeten a gallon of lemonade. Pyure blend would take over 1/2 cup! I looked on the front of the package, and it does say "blend", but it also says "stevia sweetener". Erythritol sweetener would be more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Donkeys

customer_reviews.title: I hate the aftertaste of anything that isn't sugar
customer_reviews.text: Just started the keto diet after I failed at it 2 times before. I absolutely dread Stevia. I hate the aftertaste of anything that isn't sugar. Pyure, I love you. There is a slight aftertaste, but I'm not opting to drink coffee with just cream now thanks to this beautiful product. It makes being on keto bearable when I need a sweet fix.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Spike Blood Sugars
customer_reviews.text: I love the taste of Pyure and it is one of the few artificial sweeteners that I have found that doesn't cause my blood sugar to go up. Other sweeteners like Splenda would cause my sugar to go up and I was about to just give up on trying to find one that didn't; but I stumbled upon Pyure and fell in love. Definitely recommend for diabetics and/or anyone doing Keto.
customer_reviews.author: TammiGayle

customer_reviews.title: Not As Sweet
customer_reviews.text: This is not as sweet as I thought it would be. I usually use 2 Stevia packets for a 16 oz. tea. I have to use more of this to get the equivalent sweetness. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: FL Native

customer_reviews.title: Best Calorie free sweetener
customer_reviews.text: Most calorie free sweeteners have an after taste that I do not like. Additionally, some stevia brands are not very sweet. Pyure Organic All-Purpose Blend Stevia Sweetener has no after taste and is sweet just like sugar. This is hands down the best calorie free sweetener I have found. The only con is that it is a bit pricey, but it is very concentrated and a little goes a long way: One pound of Pyure Organic Blend Stevia is about the same as two pounds of sugar.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlock

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy Pyure sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Pyure a few years to sweeten my iced tea. 3 Tablespoons perfectly sweetens a pitcher of tea to my taste. I had previously tried using it for baking and did not care for the cooling/minty flavor when I used to substitute a larger amount of sugar in that purpose. Glad to find it on Subscribe & Safe cheaper than what I may at my local superstore.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: There’s no Stevia in this!
customer_reviews.text: Label says Stevia blend but there’s no Stevia listed in the ingredients label!
customer_reviews.author: Johnson in GRMI

customer_reviews.title: NOT STEVIA
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this "stevia" for a few months now. It is labeled as stevia on the front, but it is primarily erythritol. Extremely deceptive branding and marketing. I thought I'd been using pure stevia only to find out that they are actually selling something that causes headaches and other unpleasant side effects. I'm already prone to migraines without something triggering more. Take heed when buying stevia, most of it is erythritol with a touch of stevia. LOOK AT THE INGREDIENT LIST BEFORE YOU BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Wood

customer_reviews.title: Packaging draws you, but flavor failed my stevia flavor test
customer_reviews.text: I am a stevia fan, but did not like this flavor! Whole bag just sits in fridge. I like Trader Joe's flavor best, but none close by, so I grab the Truvia blended with the cane sugar, because it is the most similiar texture for recipes, and truer sugar taste. With ANY STEVIA, don't over measure or use equal to sugar, you don't need to; that's why it gets funky tasting to many who aren't aware of this. A little is all you need, then add a little at a time if you think you need more. Again, I don't recommend the taste of this one; packaging and size drew me to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Constructive Commentor

product_meta.title: Pyure Organic Stevia Sweetener Blend, 2:1 Sugar Substitute, Granular All-Purpose, 1 Pound (16 Ounce)
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pound (Pack of 1)| Style:Granular All-PurposePyure Organic All-Purpose Stevia Sweetener is our most dynamic product to date! Pyure Brands Organic All-Purpose Blend Stevia Sweetener is the very first organic blend of the highest quality Stevia and Erythritol, creating the same taste and feel as conventional sugar. Organic Erythritol is a non-nutritive sugar alcohol that is known for its sweetness and digestibility. Pyure is granulated so that it has the same consistency and ease of use as sugar, but with a zero-glycemic index and none of the calories. From sweetening your morning coffee to baking your favorite treats, this stuff is a cult favorite and a kitchen must-have.
feature_bullets: THE #1 BEST SELLING ORGANIC STEVIA SWEETENER- Pyure offers the same versatility and ease of use as traditional sugar without the added calories or carbohydrates
2:1 SUGAR REPLACEMENT- Twice the sweetness of sugar, Pyure uses a higher percentage of organic stevia with less bulking ingredients making it approximately 2x sweeter than sugar

DELICIOUSLY SWEET GRANULATED SUGAR SUBSTITUTE- Cooks and bakes like real sugar for sweetening everything from cookies and cakes to coffees and tea or sprinkling over oatmeal and fresh fruit. Dissolves great and mixes well
TRUSTED FOR TASTE- Pyure uses the highest quality organic stevia and organic erythritol. All Ingredients are USDA Organic and non-GMO Project Verified
0 NET CARBS- Pyure is sugar-free, 0 calories, and has a 0 glycemic index, making it perfect for keto, carb conscious and sugar sensitive lifestyles

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
